meanings.definition: In a resolute or unwavering manner
meanings.sent1: She walked steadfastly towards her goal, never looking back.
meanings.sent2: He worked steadfastly on his project, ignoring all distractions.
meanings.sent3: The cat stared steadfastly at the mouse, waiting for the perfect moment to pounce.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stood steadfastly in the storm, its roots firmly anchored in the ground.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse beam shone steadfastly through the fog, guiding ships to safety.

meanings.sent1: She promised steadfastly to always support her friend, no matter what.
meanings.sent2: He stood steadfastly by his decision, despite the criticism he faced.
meanings.sent3: The little boy declared steadfastly that he would become an astronaut when he grew up.
meanings.sent4: The athlete trained steadfastly every day, never missing a workout.
meanings.sent5: The soldier saluted steadfastly as the flag was raised, showing his unwavering loyalty.
